standard_metadata.standard_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Find base and height on a triangle

question.content: A base is labeled on the triangle below.    **Which line segment shows the height that corresponds to the given base of the triangle?**

images.alt: A scalene triangle. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the base from the base to the opposite vertex. An arrow shows the length of one side of the triangle is labeled base. The other two sides are labeled, in clockwise order, A and B. The dashed line is labeled C.

hints.content: The height of a triangle extends from the base to the vertex opposite the base at a $90^\circ$ angle.  The height and the base are perpendicular.      Which line segment is perpendicular to the base?
Line segment $\purpleD{\text{C}}$ is perpendicular to the base.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A scalene triangle. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the base from the base to the opposite vertex. An arrow shows the length of one side of the triangle is labeled base. The dashed line is labeled C.

hints.content: So, $\purpleD{\text{C}}$ is the height.

question.content: A height is labeled on the triangle below.    **Which line segment shows the base that corresponds to the given height of the triangle?**

images.alt: A scalene triangle. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the base from the base to the opposite vertex. The base is labeled A. The other two sides are labeled, in clockwise order, B and C. The dashed line is labeled height.

hints.content: The base of a triangle is the side that meets the height at a $90^\circ$ angle.  The height and the base are perpendicular.      Which line segment is perpendicular to the height?
Line segment $\blueE{\text{A}}$ is perpendicular to the height.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A scalene triangle. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the base from the base to the opposite vertex. The base is labeled A. The dashed line is labeled height.

hints.content: So, $\blueE{\text{A}}$ is the base.

question.content: A height is labeled on the triangle below.    **Which line segment shows the base that corresponds to the given height of the triangle?**

images.alt: A scalene triangle. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the base from the base to the opposite vertex. The base is labeled A. The other two sides are labeled, in clockwise order, B and C. The dashed line is labeled height.

hints.content: The base of a triangle is the side that meets the height at a $90^\circ$ angle.  The height and the base are perpendicular.      Which line segment is perpendicular to the height?
Line segment $\goldE{\text{A}}$ is perpendicular to the height.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A scalene triangle. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the base from the base to the opposite vertex. The base is labeled A. The dashed line is labeled height.

hints.content: So, $\goldE{\text{A}}$ is the base.

question.content: A base is labeled on the triangle below.    **Which line segment shows the height that corresponds to the given base of the triangle?**

images.alt: A right triangle. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to a side from the side to the opposite vertex. An arrow shows the length of one side of the triangle is labeled base. The other two sides are labeled, in clockwise order, A and B. The dashed line is labeled C.

hints.content: The height of a triangle extends from the base to the vertex opposite the base at a $90^\circ$ angle.  The height and the base are perpendicular.      Which line segment is perpendicular to the base?
Line segment $\maroonD{\text{B}}$ is perpendicular to the base.    [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A scalene triangle. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to a side from the side to the opposite vertex. An arrow shows the length of one side of the triangle is labeled base. The vertical side is labeled B.

hints.content: So, $\maroonD{\text{B}}$ is the height.

question.content: A height is labeled on the triangle below.    **Which line segment shows the base that corresponds to the given height of the triangle?**

images.alt: A right triangle that is tilted.  The legs are labeled, in clockwise order, A and B.  The longest side is labeled C. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to side C from side C to the opposite vertex. The dashed line is labeled height.

hints.content: The base of a triangle is the side that meets the height at a $90^\circ$ angle.  The height and the base are perpendicular.      Which line segment is perpendicular to the height?
Line segment $\goldE{\text{C}}$ is perpendicular to the height.    [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A right triangle that is tilted. The longest side is labeled C. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to side C from side C to the opposite vertex. The dashed line is labeled height.

hints.content: So, $\goldE{\text{C}}$ is the base.

images.alt: A scalene triangle. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the base from the base to the opposite vertex. An arrow shows the length of one side of the triangle is labeled base. The other two sides are labeled, in clockwise order, B and C. The dashed line is labeled A.

question.content: A height is labeled on the triangle below.    **Which line segment shows the base that corresponds to the given height of the triangle?**

images.alt: A scalene triangle. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the base from the top vertex.  The bottom side length is labeled C.  The other two sides are labeled, in clockwise order, A and B. The dashed line is labeled height.

hints.content: The height of a triangle meets the base (or an extension of the base) at a $90^\circ$ angle.  The height and the base are perpendicular.      Which line segment is perpendicular to the height?
Line segment $\blueE{\text{C}}$ is perpendicular to the height.    [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A scalene triangle. There is a dashed line that is perpendicular to the base from the top vertex.  The bottom side length is labeled C. The dashed line is labeled height.

hints.content: So, $\blueE{\text{C}}$ is the base.

question.content: **Match the base to the corresponding height.**

hints.content: The height of a triangle extends from the base to the vertex opposite the base at a $90^\circ$ angle.  So, we need to select a height that is perpendicular to each base.
The following images show the height that corresponds with each base:  Base 1:  [[☃ image 1]]  Base 2:  [[☃ image 2]]  Base 3:  [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: Two right triangles. The first right triangle has a side length that connects the top, left vertex and the top, right vertex, and is labeled b. The second right triangle has a side length that connects the top, left vertex and the bottom, left vertex is labeled h.

Two right triangles. The first right triangle has a side length that connects the top, left vertex and the bottom, left vertex is labeled b. The second right triangle has a side length that connects the top, left vertex and the top, right vertex, and is labeled h.

Two right triangles. The first right triangle has a side length that connects the bottom, left vertex and the top, right vertex is labeled b. The second right triangle has a dashed line that is perpendicular to the longest side from the side to the opposite vertex. The dashed line is labeled h.
